intro: Tryphostemma baumii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces fluffy, cotton-like seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique nocturnal blooming habit, it is also valued as an ornamental plant in tropical gardens.
